segment.source: Porting apps to Windows 10
segment.target: Porting apps to Windows 10

segment.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]

segment.source: This section describes how to port your existing app to the Universal Windows Platform (UWP) where you can create a single Windows 10 app package that your customers can install onto all types of devices.
segment.target: This section describes how to port your existing app to the Universal Windows Platform (UWP) where you can create a single Windows 10 app package that your customers can install onto all types of devices.

segment.source: Your app will benefit from exciting new hardware, great monetization opportunities, a modern API set, adaptive UI controls, and a range of input modalities including mouse/keyboard, touch, and speech.
segment.target: Your app will benefit from exciting new hardware, great monetization opportunities, a modern API set, adaptive UI controls, and a range of input modalities including mouse/keyboard, touch, and speech.

segment.source: The Windows Runtime (WinRT) is the technology that lets you build Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.
segment.target: The Windows Runtime (WinRT) is the technology that lets you build Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.

segment.source: You can refer to What's a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app? for more background on WinRT and UWP apps.
segment.target: You can refer to What's a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app? for more background on WinRT and UWP apps.

segment.source: This porting guide explains the differences between your current app's technology and the Universal Windows Platform (UWP).
segment.target: This porting guide explains the differences between your current app's technology and the Universal Windows Platform (UWP).

segment.source: Once the path between technologies is understood, you'll be able to dive into the rest of the Developer Center, which is a comprehensive resource for developing UWP apps.
segment.target: Once the path between technologies is understood, you'll be able to dive into the rest of the Developer Center, which is a comprehensive resource for developing UWP apps.

segment.source: A good way to do that, when you're ready, is to start with How to develop a Store app.
segment.target: A good way to do that, when you're ready, is to start with How to develop a Store app.

segment.source: Topic
segment.target: Topic

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

pc.pc: Move from Windows Phone Silverlight to UWP
Move from Windows Phone Silverlight to UWP

segment.source: If you’re a developer with a Windows Phone Silverlight app, then you can make great use of your skill set and your source code in the move to Windows 10.
segment.target: If you’re a developer with a Windows Phone Silverlight app, then you can make great use of your skill set and your source code in the move to Windows 10.

segment.source: With Windows 10, you can create a UWP app, which is a single app package that your customers can install onto every kind of device.
segment.target: With Windows 10, you can create a UWP app, which is a single app package that your customers can install onto every kind of device.

pc.pc: Move from Windows Runtime 8.x to UWP
Move from Windows Runtime 8.x to UWP

segment.source: If you have a Universal 8.1 app—whether it's targeting Windows 8.1, Windows Phone 8.1, or both—then you'll find that your source code and skills will port smoothly to Windows 10.
segment.target: If you have a Universal 8.1 app—whether it's targeting Windows 8.1, Windows Phone 8.1, or both—then you'll find that your source code and skills will port smoothly to Windows 10.

segment.source: With Windows 10, you can create a UWP app, which is a single app package that your customers can install onto every kind of device.
segment.target: With Windows 10, you can create a UWP app, which is a single app package that your customers can install onto every kind of device.

pc.pc: Update your UWP Microsoft Visual Studio 2015 RC project to RTM
Update your UWP Microsoft Visual Studio 2015 RC project to RTM

segment.source: If you have a Windows 10 project that you created with Microsoft Visual Studio 2015 RC, then you have two options when it comes to updating the project files to the format suitable for Visual Studio 2015 RTM.
segment.target: If you have a Windows 10 project that you created with Microsoft Visual Studio 2015 RC, then you have two options when it comes to updating the project files to the format suitable for Visual Studio 2015 RTM.

segment.source: The recommended method is to create a new Windows 10 project in Visual Studio 2015 RTM and copy your files into it.
segment.target: The recommended method is to create a new Windows 10 project in Visual Studio 2015 RTM and copy your files into it.

segment.source: Alternatively, you can follow advanced documentation to edit your existing project files and move them over to the new format.
segment.target: Alternatively, you can follow advanced documentation to edit your existing project files and move them over to the new format.

segment.source: Are you an iOS developing, wondering how to make the move to Windows 10 and the UWP?
segment.target: Are you an iOS developing, wondering how to make the move to Windows 10 and the UWP?

segment.source: It needn't be as scary as you think.
segment.target: It needn't be as scary as you think.

segment.source: We've got the tools, techniques, and info you need to make great apps that work as well on Windows as they do on your iOS devices: maybe better!
segment.target: We've got the tools, techniques, and info you need to make great apps that work as well on Windows as they do on your iOS devices: maybe better!
